question: Who are the two brothers of the Night's Watch Sam must fight to protect Gilly when she is nearly raped?
explanation: Sam is beaten half to death trying to defend Gilly's honor. It is ultimately Ghost that scares the men off. This leaves Gilly intact and able to nurse Sam back to health, while taking his virginity at the same time. That's a heck of a thank you! This is the first and only episode in which Brant and Derek appear. Karl and Rast died a season earlier at Craster's Keep. Matthar, Balian, Niko and Escan were all newly made Rangers in the graduating class that included Sam and Jon Snow.

question: Daenerys is traded away as a bride to a "savage" in season one. Who selfishly treats her like a means to an end?
explanation: Prince Viserys (Harry Lloyd) is the older and only surviving brother of Daenerys (Emilia Clarke), but threatens her regularly with his "dragon" displeasure. He arranges a trade with the "savage" Dothraki warlord, giving her away for a promise the Dothraki will fight for him. Despite his selfish, delusional ways, Daenerys saves him after he attacks her and a Dothraki wants to kill him for it. But when Viserys pulls a weapon and threatens her unborn child, husband Khal Drogo (Jason Momoa) pours molten gold over her brother's head. Daenerys doesn't look away or flinch. She remarks instead he was no true dragon.

question: The Night King has so far been the main villain of the series. At the conclusion of season 7, he destroys part of the Wall. He is able to accomplish this by using one of Daenerys' dragons to burn a hole in the wall. Which dragon does he kill?
explanation: The Night King kills Viserion with a fantastic throw of a spear. This happens when Daenerys decides to rescue Jon Snow's party that went out to capture a wight. No one in Westeros is currently aware that the Night King reanimated Viserion.

question: At the conclusion of season 7, Cersei Lannister commands Euron Greyjoy to sail across the sea to pick up an elite group of sellswords. What is the name of the group?
explanation: The Golden Company is an an elite group of sellswords, founded during the Blackfyre rebellion. This rebellion which happened about 100 years before the series started, came about because the king at the time fathered several bastards who all wanted the throne and started a series of wars (rebellions) over the throne.

question: What is the name of Jon's direwolf?
explanation: Ghost, unlike the other direwolves found by the Starks, is an albino described by Theon Greyjoy as "the runt of the litter". Nymeria was Arya's direwolf whom she freed in the Riverlands. Otherwise, Nymeria would be killed for attacking Joffrey. Grey Wind and Summer, both deceased, were Robb and Bran's direwolves respectively.

question: Which name is given to the bastards of The Reach?
explanation: The bastards born in noble families can be identified by their different surnames, according to the region where they were born. In The Reach they receive the name of Flowers, probably a reference to the characteristics of the region, since it's a fertile land.

question: What is the main religion of the Seven Kingdoms?
explanation: The Faith of the Seven is the dominant religion in Westeros. The Old Gods of the Forest are worshipped especially in The North, through the many weirwood trees. The Drowned God is the deity worshipped in the Iron Islands and the Great Stallion by the Dothraki.

question: It was Jon Arryn's sudden death that brought Ned Stark to King's Landing, where he sought the truth behind Lord Arryn's demise. Who actually killed Robert's first "Hand of the King?"
explanation: Lysa Arryn's note, sent to her sister Catelyn Stark, accusing the Lannisters of her husband's murder, set into motion the chaos and bloodshed that followed. Petyr Baelish, however, had convinced Lysa to poison her own husband.

question: Which House is a direct vassal of House Baratheon of King's Landing?
explanation: Stokeworth is a vassal House to the House Baratheon of King's Landing, and since its castle is located in the Crownlands, they are directly loyal to the monarch. We can see, for instance, Bronn walking with Lollys Stokeworth moments before Jaime Lannister hires him in order to rescue Myrcella from the Martells in Dorne.

question: The Water Gardens belong to which constituency of Westeros?
explanation: The Water Gardens belong to Dorne, ruled by House Martell. They are located near Sunspear.

question: In the first episode, King Robert Baratheon says "In my dreams, I kill him every night." To whom is the King referring and why?
answer_short: Rhaegar Targaryen because he kidnapped Lyanna Stark
explanation: While Robert is visiting Winterfell, he visits the memorial of Lyanna Stark located down in the crypts. Lyanna, Ned Stark's sister, was promised to Robert before she was kidnapped by Rhaegar Targaryen. Robert started the rebellion because she was taken from him. Fans of the show will notice hints that Lyanna was not actually kidnapped, but she ran away to be with Rhaegar.

question: At Hoster Tully's funeral, who shot the burning arrow that hit its mark?
explanation: Edmure Tully had the right to shoot the arrow. However, after many unsuccessful attempts Brynden Tully took the bow for his brother's last rite, setting the floating man afire.

question: "I always hated crossbows. Take too long to load!"
explanation: In season 2, Yoren was killed by Ser Amory Lorch after Yoren refused to give Ser Amory the location of Gendry. Gendry was one of King Robert's bastards, but Yoren defended him because he was going to be a brother of the Night's Watch.

question: In season 2, who does Tyrion tell Varys he is planning on marrying to Princess Myrcella?
explanation: In season 2, Tyrion tells Grand Maester Pycelle, Varys, and Petyr Baelish that he is planning on arranging the marriage of Princess Myrcella. Tyrion's goal was to figure out if any of the fellow Small Council members are spying for Cersei. Tyrion tells Grand Maester Pyrcelle (who turns out to be the spy) that he is planning to marry Princess Myrcella to the Martells of Dorne, he tells Varys he is planning on marrying Myrcella to Theon Greyjoy, and he tells Littlefinger that he is planning to marry Myrcella to Robin Arryn of the Vale. When Tyrion is called into Cersei's chambers later that night, Cersei accuses him of plotting to send away her only daughter to Dorne. At that moment, Tyrion knows that Pycelle is the spy, and after he leaves Cersei's chambers he finds Bronn and they pay Pycelle a very special visit.

question: How many fingertips did Stannis Baratheon chop off of Davos' hand(s)?
explanation: Davos was a smuggler for the bigger part of his life. He was well known for being able to slip past sentries. One day the castle Storm's End was under siege and Stannis Baratheon, who was defending the castle, ran out of his food supplies. That was when Davos slipped past the enemy's lines and got into Storm's End with lots of food, mainly onions. For this, Stannis Baratheon rewarded Davos with lands and knighthood. Davos choose 'Seaworth' for his house's name. Unfortunately, Stannis also chopped off four of Davos' fingertips for his smuggling days. "A good act does not wash out the bad, nor bad the good" - Stannis Baratheon

question: Who is king of Westeros when the the series begins?
explanation: Eddard Stark is Lord of Winterfell. Tywin Lannister is Lord of Westerlands. Aerys Targaryan was king before Robert.

question: What is the name of the continent on which most of the action of "Game of Thrones" takes place?
explanation: Almost all of the continent, with the exception of the Wall and lands beyond, is under the rule of the Seven Kingdoms.  Westeros contains a variety of terrain including forests, mountains and deserts.

question: What is one of Sam's nicknames?
explanation: When Sam arrives at Castle Black, during his first sword fighting session, he squeals repeatedly as he's being beaten. Alliser Thorne notes the South is now sending him "squealing bloody pigs". Jon Snow comes to Sam's defense, so Thorne orders Jon to fight against three brothers to "defend his lady love". Thorne says the three of them should be enough to "make lady piggy squeal". After this, Piggy or Lady Piggy become the names the more hateful brothers use to refer to Sam at times. Pyp once referred to Sam as "Prince Pork-chop" before they became friends.

question: Daenerys finds great happiness with her "sun and stars" Khal Drogo, but who destroys both the husband and the unborn son?
explanation: Daenerys compassion for slaves and women in particular causes her to intervene and save a witch, a healer maegi, whom the Dothraki were molesting. Mirri Maz Duur (Mia Soteriou) repays that kindness by offering to heal a small wound in Drogo, but instead it festers. Duur uses blood magic to give Drogo life, but it's catatonic life, and the magic kills his unborn child. Mirri Maz Duur explains the Dothraki already raped her, and burned her village, so she felt no gratitude toward Daenerys. Most of all, she did not want a Dothraki baby who grows up to be the "Stallion Who Mounts the World". Daenerys ties her to Drogo's funeral pyre and burns her alive, unaffected by the screams.

question: In a flashback scene, we discover the true patronage of Jon Snow's parents. All through the series, we are led to believe Ned Stark is Jon's dad, and Jon is his bastard son. But this is not true - who is Jon's real father?
explanation: Jon's true parents are Rhaegar Targaryen and Lyanna Stark, Ned's younger sister. Everyone in the kingdom believes Rhaegar captured Lyanna and stole her. This led to the rebellion that occurs, 16 years before the series starts. However, Lyanna and Rhaegar were secretly married and Lyanna gave birth to Jon, dying in the process. Ned lies about his real identity to protect him from Robert.

question: What is Olenna's relationship to Mace Tyrell?
explanation: Olenna's only known son is Mace Tyrell, making Loras and Margaery her grandchildren. Mace and his children were all killed during the explosion of the Great Sept of Baelor. Since Olenna is too old to bear any child and is a widow, it is expected that House Tyrell will face extinction.

question: Which name is given to the bastards of The Westerlands?
explanation: Stone is the surname given to bastards born in The Vale, Snow from those of The North and Rivers to those of The Riverlands. Other names include Flowers (from The Reach), Pyke (Iron Islands), Storm (The Stormlands), Waters (The Crownlands) and Sand (Dorne).

question: Which religion does the Brotherhood Without Banners preach?
explanation: The Brotherhood Without Banners serves the interests of the poor and do not fight or serve any specific Lord or King. Thoros of Myr is himself a Priest of the Lord of Light and generally the Brotherhood preaches this religion.

question: What nasty creature felled a drunken King Robert?
explanation: Drugged and drunk thanks to his scheming wife Cersei, King Robert was gored by a boar on a hunting trip. On his deathbed, Robert named Ned Stark "Protector of the Realm."

question: Which tongue is commonly used by the Priests or Priestesses of R'hllor?
explanation: Commonly used by Melisandre, High Valyrian is one of the many languages we can see on the show. When she meets Thoros of Myr in the Riverlands, another priest of the Lord of Light, we can see that he also speaks the tongue. Daenerys is also able to speak it fluently, and we assume that other Targaryens were also fluent in High Valyrian, since the original seat of this House was the now ruined city of Valyria, in Essos.

question: Though Dragonstone was the seat of the Targaryens in former times, which self-proclaimed king of Westeros can we find there at a certain moment of the show?
explanation: Dragonstone is an island which belongs to the Crownlands. It is located near the famous Blackwater Bay, where the Battle of the Blackwater took place.

question: At the end of his training, what must an Unsullied kill to prove he has no mercy or weakness?
explanation: Daenerys travels to Astapor to buy an army. She has heard of the Unsullied, who are elite warriors known to show no fear and unquestioning obedience. She meets with one of the slave masters, Kraznys mo Nakloz, who shows a squadron of Unsullied to her. Daenerys learns Unsullied are trained from the age of five to fight and feel no emotion. The slave master has one of the Unsullied sliced across the chest to show that the warrior does not even flinch at the pain. To prove the Unsullied kill without question or mercy, they have to kill a newborn slave child to complete their training. Upon learning this, Daenerys has to appear pleased to keep up appearances, but we know she is making a plan to destroy the cruel slave masters and make the Unsullied free men.

question: Who was the liege lord of the Freys before the War of the Five Kings?
explanation: The Freys of the Twins were under the Lord of the Riverlands, Hoster Tully.

question: "Say it. Say her name. Say it!"
explanation: In season 4, Oberyn was killed by Ser Gregor Clegane during Tyrion Lannister's trial by combat. During King Robert's rebellion, Tywin Lannister ordered the murder of Elia Martell and her entire family, but Ser Gregor took it even further by butchering the children, then raping Elia before killing her. Oberyn was seeking revenge for her death, and almost had it, before making a fatal mistake.

question: What is the sigil of the House Clegane?
explanation: The House Clegane, loyal to the House Lannister, displays on its sigil three dogs (or hounds) over a yellow field. These dogs represent some dogs that died saving a Lannister Lord years ago.

question: What was the name of the person who chopped off Jaime's right hand?
explanation: Locke was one of the men Roose Bolton set out to capture the escaped Jaime Lannister. Locke managed to find Jaime and planned to bring his captive back to Roose Bolton. Jaime tried to buy his way out of captivity. Instead of accepting his offer, Locke decided to take things in his own hands, by chopping off Jaime's hand. Unfortunately for Locke, Roose Bolton did not approve of this.

question: What noble house is Catelyn Stark from?
explanation: She married Eddard Stark.

question: At the end of season 2, Joffrey Baratheon sits on the Iron Throne, but which Baratheon is actually the rightful king?
explanation: Stannis is the brother of King Robert Baratheon.  Robert's widow Cersei placed her fifteen year-old son Joffrey on the throne, but Joffrey was not Robert's biological heir, a fact that Cersei strove to keep secret.  Since King Robert had no true heirs, Stannis should be the rightful heir to the Iron Throne.  Stannis said, "The Iron Throne is mine by right. All those that deny that are my foes."

question: Where did Sam get the thimble that he gave to Gilly?
explanation: As a child, Sam would sit and read to his mother while she sewed, so she gave him her thimble when his father made him leave Horn Hill and join the Watch. When the Night's Watch was forced to leave Craster's Keep, Sam wants to give Gilly the only thing he has that means anything to him. He wants her to keep it safe for him until he comes back for her.

question: Khaleesi Daenerys is directed to go live among the widows of Khal warlords, but instead she does what to the Dothraki warlords who will not serve a woman?
explanation: Khaleesi Daenerys assumed her power as Drogo's queen of the Dothraki, and after emerging unharmed from Drogo's funeral fire, she's Mother of Dragons as well, confident of her true destiny. She need bow to no one. When Khal Moro (Joe Naufahu) and other Dothraki warlords capture her and threaten rape or enslavement, and then insist she must live at the Vaes Dothrak where all widows of Khal must stay, Daenerys calls them "small men" not fit to lead, though SHE is. She sets their tent on fire. She watches each man burn, then emerges from the fire unscathed.

question: Bran Stark, now the three-eyed raven, took a perilous quest to go north and find the previous three-eyed raven. What lovable but simple man, who could speak one single word, died for Bran while they were escaping from wights?
explanation: Hodor dies in a sad scene has he gives his life to hold a door closed, so Bran has time to escape. To avoid getting too complicated, Bran enters Hodor's mind to control him to hold the door. This memory enters a young Hodor's mind and messes with him. Thus leading to Hodor only being able to say one word "Hodor". "Hodor" being a shortened form of "Hold the door".

question: Why could Jon leave the Night's Watch, since his vows were for life?
explanation: After taking the vows, a man has to serve in the Night's Watch until he dies ("It shall not end until my death."). Desertion is punished with death. Jon was stabbed to death by his comrades and then resurrected by Melisandre, so there was no reason he would remain in the Night's Watch if he intended to help Sansa conquer the North.

question: Which name is given to the inhabitants of The Neck?
explanation: The inhabitants of The Neck are often called crannogmen. Those who live north of the Wall call themselves Free Folk. Dornishmen are the inhabitants of Dorne and Ironborn is the name given to those born in the Iron Islands.

question: What does The Warrior represent in the Faith of the Seven?
answer_short: Strength and courage on the battlefield
explanation: The Faith of the Seven recognizes seven different "faces" of the same deity. Death is represented by The Stranger, who also represents the unknown. Justice is embodied by The Father, who judges the souls of those who die, and beauty, love and innocence are represented by The Maiden.

question: On the orders of King Joffrey, Ilyn Payne beheads Ned Stark with which ancient sword?
explanation: Ned Stark was executed with Ice, his own family's Valyrian steel broadsword. It was later reforged into Oathkeeper (given by Jaime Lannister to Brienne of Tarth) and Widow's Wail (given to King Joffrey Baratheon as a wedding gift).

question: What is the motto of House Greyjoy?
explanation: "Hear Me Roar" is the motto of House Lannister and, contrary to what many think, "A Lannister always pays his debts" and "The Lannisters send their regards" are not part of the motto, they are just sayings. "Family, Duty, Honor" is the motto of House Tully and "Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken" of House Martell.

question: Which sword was wielded by Visenya Targaryen?
explanation: Visenya wielded Dark Sister, one of the swords made of the extremely rare Valyrian steel. Ice was wielded by Eddard Stark before it was melted. Heartsbane belongs to the House Tarly and Widow's Wail (one of the swords made with the steel of Ice) was Joffrey Baratheon's sword.

question: Who was the Lightning Lord?
explanation: Lord Beric was nicknamed "The Lightning Lord" due to the lighting bolt on his shield.

question: Who attempts to kill Tyrion on the battlefield in the Battle of Blackwater Bay?
explanation: After The Hound and King Joffrey abandon the battlefield, Tyrion is forced to put together a group of men to lead the attack. They travel through secret underground tunnels of King's Landing, and successfully beat the enemies in front of them. Moments later, however, reinforcements from Stannis' army rush to the Mud Gate and overwhelm Tyrion and his troops. In the midst of the battle, Tyrion locks eyes with a White Knight of the Kingsguard, Ser Mandon Moore. In a shocking turn of events, Ser Mandon steps toward Tyrion and slashes him in the face with his sword. Luckily for Tyrion, Tyrion's squire Podrick comes to the rescue and kills Ser Mandon before Ser Mandon can finish the job. It is later discovered that King Joffrey ordered Ser Mandon to kill Tyrion.

question: Who is in the tent when Renly Baratheon is killed by the mysterious shadow?
explanation: Just before Melisandre's creation enters the tent, Renly and Catelyn are talking about the war and Robb's loyalty.

question: How many kings were there in The Seven Kingdoms at the end of season 2?
explanation: After King Robert Baratheon's death, his son Joffrey (whose father was actually Jaime) was the first person to proclaim himself king. Renly Baratheon, Robert's youngest brother was the second. He had no right to that throne, because he was fourth in line (actually second, because Joffrey and Tommen were not Robert's sons). Robb Stark was the third, styling himself The King in the North. Stannis Baratheon was the fourth. He was the only one who mentioned that Joffrey and Tommen were born of incest between Jaime and Cersei; this made Stannis the next king because he was next in line. Balon Greyjoy was the fifth and last. His reason for being king was basically "because he could". Renly was murdered during season 2'; that left 4 kings at the end of the season. Mance Raydar doesn't count as king because everything north of The Wall isn't even part of The Seven Kingdoms.

question: Who is the true heir to the iron throne after Robert's death?
explanation: Stannis is the true heir because Robert didn't have any true born sons.

question: In 2011, which actor who plays Tyrion Lannister, won the Golden Globe award for Best Performance by an Actor in a Supporting Role in a Series?
explanation: Dinklage may be small in stature, but he wields power and commands respect in his role of Tyrion Lannister, the Hand of the King.  However, Tyrion is greatly disliked by his father Tywin Lannister because his wife died giving birth to the dwarf-sized son. His sister Cersei Lannister Baratheon despises him for the same reason.  Tyrion must bear being called names such as "The Imp" and "Halfman".

question: Under what religion was Sam named as a child?
explanation: Although named in the light of the Seven, Sam decides to convert to the Old Gods to take his Night's Watch vows under the weirwood tree with Jon Snow. When the Lord Commander asked why he would forsake his Gods, Sam replies, "the Seven have never answered my prayers, perhaps the Old Gods will."

question: At the slave city of Astapor Daenerys uses clever strategy to outwit the vulgar slavedriver Kraznys mo Nakloz, bargaining over which creature?
explanation: The dragons are old enough now to be a priceless wonder, so it's no surprise Kraznys mo Nakloz (Dan Hildebrand), the Astapor slavedriver, wants one for himself. He barters with Daenerys, who wants the army of the famous Unsullied, slave soldier eunuchs.  The slave Missandei (Nathalie Emmanuel) translates, but dares not translate his true, insulting comments. Secretly Daenerys understands every word. She pretends to agree to the terms, and hands over her young dragon. He gives her command of the Unsullied. But as he's struggling to control the dragon, she commands it to breathe fire upon the insolent Nakloz, roasting him to death. She then frees the Unsullied.

question: Sam, who is the arguably the weakest, slowest, and most out-of-shape member of the Night's Watch, somehow manages to escape a mutiny at Craster's Keep. While escaping, he rescues a daughter of Craster. What is her name?
explanation: During their escape, a whitewalker follows them to capture Gilly's son. Sam manages to stab and kill the whitewalker with dragon glass. Sam becomes the first person in 8000 years to kill a whitewalker.

question: Who did Jon execute after his first general meeting as Lord Commander with the men of the Night's Watch?
explanation: After assigning Janos Slynt to repair and keep one of the Night's Watch castles (Greyguard, near Shadow Tower), he refuses the order and insults the Lord Commander. Jon orders Olly to fetch his sword and, after all men gather outside, he beheads Slynt.

question: The destruction of the Great Sept of Baelor caused many casualties. Which two characters died during the explosion?
explanation: In an attempt to get her revenge, Cersei orchestrates a plan to destroy the Great Sept of Baelor using the wildfire stocked beneath it during the reign of the Mad King. During Loras' trial, one of Qyburn's "little birds" lures Lancel Lannister to the tunnels beneath the Sept. He watches as a candle burns and the wildfire ignites. The entire Sept and nearby buildings explode. The casualties include Margaery, Loras and Mace Tyrell, Kevan Lannister and the High Sparrow.

question: Who believes in the Old Gods of the Forest?
explanation: Eddard Stark can be seen praying near a weirwood tree, while Jon Snow takes his vows as a brother of the Night's Watch near a weirwood tree as well north of the wall. Catelyn Stark, Lancel Lannister and Tommen Baratheon are devoted to the Faith of the Seven and Balon Greyjoy, on the other hand, worshipped the Drowned God.

question: Sansa Stark and Tyrion Lannister were suspected of poisoning King Joffrey. Who, however, really did the little monster in?
explanation: The "Queen of Thorns" had no intention of seeing her granddaughter wed to King Robert's illegitimate and sadistic heir.

question: Which houses have symbols in their sigils related to the sea?
explanation: House Manderly's sigil is a merman, while Upcliff's sigil is a wave. However, both House Tully and House Greyjoy also have symbols in their sigils related to the sea (trout and Kraken respectively).

question: What is the name of the gate that leads to The Eyrie?
explanation: The Eyrie, said to be impregnable to attack, belongs to The Vale. The gate which leads to the seat of House Arryn is called The Bloody Gate. It was here that both Arya and Sandor Clegane were made aware of the death of Arya's aunt Lysa Arryn.

question: What distinct feature does Brienne of Tarth recall about the entity that killed Renly Baratheon?
explanation: The shadow assassin, more affectionately known as the shadow baby, was brought forth after a coupling between the Red Woman (Melisandre) and Stannis Baratheon. While Melisandre was the one who physically brought the shadow forward, Stannis ordered the murder, so it is only fitting that the shadow should have his face.

question: What was the name of the boy Arya was playing with (and who later died) when Nymeria attacked Joffrey?
explanation: Mycah and Arya were "sword fighting", when Joffrey and Sansa came, and Joffrey tried to hurt Mycah.

question: "Together we can end this war in a fortnight!"
explanation: In season 2, Renly Baratheon was killed by Melisandre's shadow creature after negotiations with his brother Stannis failed. Catelyn Stark was sent to Storm's end to negotiate with Renly. Catelyn proposed the idea of Robb joining forces with Renly to defeat the Lannisters, and Renly accepted the terms. However, immediately after the terms were agreed upon, a shadow crept into Renly's tent and stabbed him through the heart.

question: How many times did Thoros of Myr resurrect Beric Dondarrion from death, up until the end of season 3?
explanation: Thoros of Myr was one of the many people who worshipped The Lord of Light as god. According to Thoros, the power of the resurrections came from that one true god.

question: What is that name of Robb Stark's wife?
explanation: Catelyn was upset that they married as Robb was promised to someone else.

question: Aside from being Master of Coin and a member of the King's Small Council, the character of Peter "Littlefinger" Baelish from King's Landing also runs what kind of business?
explanation: Littlefinger spies on patrons of his brothel in order to gain useful information against possible political rivals.  As Master of the Coin, he oversees the treasury.  He was given this position during the reign of King Robert Baratheon and continued in the position when King Joffrey Baratheon inherited the throne after Robert's death.

question: After the Battle of the Fist of the First Men, as the survivors are trying to make it back to the Wall, Sam collapses from exhaustion. Which of his brothers wishes to leave him because he is slowing them down?
explanation: Grenn and Edd initially left Sam when they heard the three horn blasts signaling White Walkers were approaching, but on the way back to the Wall, they tried to help Sam when he collapsed. After the Battle, Mormont was very angry with Sam for not getting the ravens out, but later orders a very angry Rast to make sure Sam makes it back alive, saying "if he doesn't, you don't".

question: Yara Greyjoy is the only daughter of Balon Greyjoy and Theon's older sister. When Theon is later captured by Ramsay Bolton, Yara launches a rescue mission to free Theon. Where was Theon being held?
explanation: Theon is captured after he takes Winterfell. Ramsay takes him back to the Dreadfort and tortures him mentally and physically. Eventually, Theon manages to escape with Sansa, and they are rescued by Brienne of Tarth.

question: What is Meera's relationship to Howland Reed?
explanation: Howland is Meera and Jojen's father and the head of House Reed, a vassal House loyal to the Starks.

question: Where did Jon take his Night's Watch vows?
answer_short: Beside a weirwood tree north of the Wall
explanation: Jon Snow took his vows before a weirwood tree with Samwell Tarly. In his speech to the future brothers of the Night's Watch, Lord Commander Jeor Mormont asked who believed in the Old Gods: both Jon and Sam stand up.

question: What are the names of Elia Martell's children?
explanation: Elia Martell was Oberyn and Doran's sister. She was married to Rhaegar Targaryen and was killed by Gregor Clegane during Robert's Rebellion. The Mountain was also responsible for killing her daughter Rhaenys and her son Aegon.

question: Which religion does the Faith Militant preach?
explanation: The Faith Militant is a religious military order who seeks, at the orders of the monarch and High Septon, to spread the faith and religious rituals by force. During the reign of Tommen Baratheon, the Faith Militant was reestablished.

question: Each night before sleep Arya Stark speaks the names of those she wishes dead. Who wasn't on little Arya's original "hit list?"
explanation: Arya's made lots of enemies on her terrible journeys, but the original list included only those who wronged her and her family prior to her escape from King's Landing. Lord Frey would eventually land of Arya's list, but not until after the events of the "Red Wedding."

question: Which houses have animals in their sigils?
explanation: House Lydden's sigil is a badger, Hornwood is a bullmoose, Blackmont is a vulture and the Starks have a direwolf as their sigil. House Swann, for instance, has two swans in its crest. It is interesting to note that some of the most iconic and powerful Houses in Westeros have animals in their sigils, such as Houses Stark, Baratheon, Arryn, Tully or Greyjoy.

question: Which chemical was used during the Battle of the Blackwater to destroy Stannis Baratheon's fleet?
explanation: Wilfire is a very dangerous green-coloured substance, used by Tyrion Lannister in order to destroy Stannis' fleet when he intended to conquer King's Landing through Blackwater Bay. During the battle, it was lit by Bronn's fire arrow. Milk of the poppy is used as an anesthetic, while Essence of Nightshade has also a medical use but can be fatal. The Strangler is a poison, used to kill Joffrey Baratheon during his wedding.

question: In which Westeros constituency can we find The Dreadfort?
explanation: The Dreadfort is the seat of House Bolton. It is located in the North (initially ruled by House Stark), near Weeping Water.

question: The Hound says, "Killing is the sweetest thing there is." To whom does he say this, and why?
answer_short: To Sansa in an attempt to scare her out of her fantasy world
explanation: It's pretty obvious that the Hound cares for Sansa. Out of all the characters she encounters, he is the only one who truly tries to help her. One such event is when he saves her from the men who abduct her during the riots. Later, when she tried to thank him, the Hound is being his usual gruff self. Sansa scolds him for always being so cruel. He tells her that killing is the sweetest thing, and while she tells herself otherwise, even her noble father loved to do it too. When Sansa is distressed, she tends to revert to her old ways of believing life is like one of her stories where ladies are beautiful and all knights are chivalrous. When the Hound tells her things like this, he is trying to get her to see the world for what is really is so she can better protect herself.

question: Who is Myrcella betrothed to in season 2?
explanation: Tyrion brokered the match, in order to bring Dorne closer to Iron Throne. Myrcella was then shipped to Dorne, to live with the Martells.

question: "We are the watchers on the wall!"
explanation: In season 2, Qhorin Halfhand was killed by Jon Snow on his demands. Qhorin and Jon were both captured by a group of wildlings, and were on their way to Mance Rayder to face punishment (most likely death) when Qhorin told Jon he needed to do whatever he could do gain the wildling's trust. Qhorin knew that Mance would kill both of them, so he let Jon Snow kill him hoping the wildlings would allow him into their camp.

question: What is Daenerys' response to Kraznys mo Nakloz after he tells Missandei to tell Daenerys that her "beast won't come" to him after the exchange of Drogon for the army of Unsullied?
explanation: After Daenerys exchanges her largest dragon, Drogon, for an army of Unsullied, Kraznys mo Nakloz, the slave trader, struggles to hold onto the leash around Drogon's foot. He tells Missandei to tell Daenerys that her "beast" won't come to him. Without waiting for Missandei's translation, Daenerys turns to Kraznys and says "A dragon is not a slave". Shocked that she understood him, he asks her if she speaks Valyrian. She then says "I am Daenerys Stormborn of the House Targaryen, of the blood of Old Valyria. Valyrian is my mother tongue". Daenerys then orders her new Unsullied soldiers to kill all of the masters, and in the process, commands Drogon to burn Kraznys alive by saying the word "Dracarys".

question: When Melisandre says that 'There is power in a King's blood', who is she thinking of offering as sacrifice to the Red God?
explanation: Even when Gendry was never acknowledged as Robert's son or heir to the throne, Robert's blood (and Stannis' blood) runs into Gendry's veins... King's blood.

question: To how many different Starks had Sandor Clegane, called The Hound, spoken in seasons 1-3?
explanation: He didn't say much to Eddard Stark, only the words "He ran... But not very fast", after he killed Mycah, the butcher's son. He did have a few conversations with Sansa in season 1 and 2, and traveled with Arya in season 3.

question: What is the name of Arya Stark's sword?
explanation: Arya Stark is the daughter of Lord Eddard and Lady Catelyn Stark.  The sword is a gift from her half-brother Jon Snow.  She is trained in sword fighting, and when her father tells her that a little lady shouldn't play with swords, she replies, "I wasn't playing.  And I don't want to be a lady."

question: It's usually Sam's brains and not his bronze that gets him out of most situations. Because he knows so many things from staring at marks on paper, what does Gilly believe he must be?
explanation: After Sam tells Gilly a long story about an abandoned castle and a secret tunnel they can use to get south of the Wall, she tells him, "You're like a wizard". Sam beams with pride as he's never been admired by anyone before. Also, in Season One, Sam tried to console Jon when he angry he put with the stewards. When Jon said, "I always wanted to be a ranger", Sam replied, "I always wanted to be a wizard".

question: The Warlock of Qarth steals the dragons belonging to Daenerys, and chains them up in what tower of illusions?
explanation: Ser Jorah Mormont and Daenerys circle the House of the Undying, a tower without openings, into which Daenerys disappears. She sees visions of the Red Keep, the great Wall, and her dead husband and son. She finds her dragons chained up by the warlock Pyat Pree. He chains Daenerys. But when Daenerys gives the command, "Dracarys", the dragons toast Pyat. Also in Qarth the merchant Xaro Xhoan Daxos (Nonso Anozie) met Daenerys at the city gates and promised ships, proposing marriage. Xaro and Pyat Press then stage a coup, kill the city rulers and steal the dragons. Also dead are Daenerys's maid and men, because the bedslave Doreah (Roxanne McKee) betrayed Daenerys. In response, Daenerys locks both Xaro and Doreah in a vault, to slowly starve and die together.

question: Jorah Mormont, Daenery's trusted advisor for most of the series, becomes afflicted with a deadly disease that was thought incurable. What is the name of this disease?
explanation: Jorah obtains this disease while transporting Tyrion through the ruins of old Valyria. Greyscale causes scales to form and cover the entire body, while the afflicted person slowly loses their sanity. The cure of greyscale mostly involved the extremely painful process of simply removing most of the person's outer skin.

question: During the Red Wedding, which Houses were allies against the Starks?
explanation: The massacre was orchestrated by Tywin Lannister, who forged a secret alliance with the Freys and the Boltons in order to defeat the Starks. Though Tywin was absent from the wedding, "The Rains of Castamere" was the signal for the Boltons and Freys to attack Robb and his family. Moreover, Roose Bolton says "The Lannisters send their regards" to Robb before killing him.

question: To whom Jon says "If I fall, don't bring me back."?
explanation: Jon Snow says this to Melisandre before the battle with Ramsay Bolton, since she was the one who revived him, supposedly with the help of the Lord of Light. If he died during the battle, he did not wish to be brought back to life once again.

question: What is the guest right?
answer_short: When a guest eats or drinks in the host's table and beneath his roof, neither the guest or the host can harm each other
explanation: The guest right is an ancient tradition and social rule in Westeros, held as inviolable and sacred (regardless of which religion is preached). The most iconic violation of the guest right was done during the Red Wedding, where the host Walder Frey murdered Robb, Talisa and Catelyn Stark, his guests, who had a wedding feast in The Twins.

question: The "Red Wedding" claimed the lives of many a Stark. Which member of that northern clan  DIDN'T die as a guest of Walder Frey?
explanation: Why would anyone ever attend a wedding in Westeros? Benjen, Ned's brother and First Ranger, was lost and assumed dead north of the Wall when the slaughter at the Twins took place.

question: In which cities did Daenerys stop by before taking up residence in Meereen after crossing the Red Waste?
explanation: Qarth, ruled by the Thirteen, is an exotic place where warlocks and assassins can be found. Astapor and Yunkai are known for their slave trade. Astapor specifically is known for the Unsullied, who were freed by Daenerys.

question: On their way to Meereen, Jorah and Tyrion find the stone men near the ancient ruins of which place?
explanation: While sailing in the Smoking Sea, both Tyrion Lannister and Jorah Mormont have a dangerous encounter with the stone men, plagued by a contagious disease called Greyscale. Once the seat of House Targaryen, Valyria and the surrounding places are now deserted, except for the previously mentioned stone men. It is also in this place that Tyrion sees for the first time a living dragon, Drogon.

question: "You'll have to carry me."
explanation: In season 2, Arya's friend and travel companion Lommy had an injured leg after being shot with an arrow. When they were captured, Lommy asked the captors to carry him. They killed him instead.

question: What is the first thing Jon Snow says in the first episode in season 4?
answer_short: "Last time I saw him, he was in the courtyard at Winterfell".
explanation: As Sam is heading up the stairs to Jon's keep to tell Jon that Ser Aliser Thorne is ready to see him regarding what took place after Jon and Qhorin Halfhand were captured, we can hear Jon talk to Sam about Jon's brother Robb. The first thing we hear him say is "Last time I saw him, he was in the courtyard at Winterfell".

question: Bronn, sellsword under the command of Tyrion, was awarded for his service in the Blackwater Battle against Stannis' army. What was this reward?
explanation: In an attempt to gain his favour, Cersei anointed Bronn as knight and promised him a suitable wife and prosperous lands.

question: How many of the Stark direwolves were confirmed dead in the first three seasons?
explanation: We saw Sansa's direwolf, Lady, killed by Eddard, after queen Cersei Lannister ordered the beast dead. Robb's direwolf also got killed during his uncle's wedding at The Twins.

question: What house has a sigil of a silver trout?
explanation: House Stark sigil is a dire wolf. House Tyrell sigil is a golden rose. House Greyjoy sigil is golden kraken.

question: By what name do the Seven Kingdoms refer to the Free Folk who live in north beyond the Wall?
explanation: The Free Folk live on the continent of Westeros, but beyond the realm of the Seven Kingdoms.  As their name suggests, they consider themselves free from political authority and claims to the land.

question: What is the name of the ancestral Valyrian steel sword belonging to House Tarly?
explanation: As Sam and Gilly decide to leave Horn Hill during the night, Sam first stops to grab the family sword from over the mantel. Gilly is concerned his father may be angry and come after it, to which Sam replies, "He can bloody well try". Sam is truly becoming a man! Sam later gives the sword to Jorah Mormont, stating it was Jorah's father who taught him to become a man, and he thought the sword should belong to someone who could at least hold it upright.

question: Daenerys frees a slave in Astapor who becomes a close friend and advisor. Who loves an Unsullied, but Daenerys will watch her beheaded?
explanation: Missandei was freed of her slavery when Daenerys took Astapor and became "Breaker of Chains". After that, Missandei stood firm by Daenerys through their every tribulation, including a chilly and ungrateful reception from people in the North. After surviving the Battle of Winterfell the Unsullied Grey Worm (Jacob Anderson) and Missandei are happy together on a ship, when it is attacked. Euron Greyjoy (Pilou Asbaek) captures Missandei and takes her to Queen Cersei (Lena Headey), who offers Daenerys the life of Missandei in exchange for surrender. Daenerys of course will not surrender. She has to watch as Gregor "The Mountain" Clegane (Hafpor Julius Bjornsson) beheads her friend.

question: Arya Stark, the youngest Stark girl, was given a blade by Jon Snow back in season 1. This blade has become Arya's most treasured possession. This blade often comes in handy as Arya becomes a deadly killer. What is the name of the sword?
explanation: Needle is an extremely thin sword, hence its name. Jon gives this to Arya as a gift before he leaves for the Wall. Jon and Arya have not seen each other since Jon gave Arya her sword, which occurred in season 1 episode 2.

question: Which House has no remaining legitimate heirs at the time Cersei Lannister becomes Queen of Westeros?
explanation: Following the destruction of the Great Sept of Baelor, King Tommen Baratheon commits suicide after acknowledging the death of his wife, amongst others. He was the last living person bearing the surname Baratheon.

question: Jon orders Rickon's body to be buried where?
explanation: Rickon is killed by Ramsay Bolton at the start the battle between the latter and Jon Snow. When men of Jon's army show him the body, he orders them to bury Rickon in the crypt of the Stark family.

question: Which brother of the Night's Watch brought an end to Ygritte and (temporarily) Jon Snow?
explanation: Olly watched his family and village slaughtered by Wildling reavers, and thus killing Ygritte (Jon Snow's Wildling lover) with an arrow was understandable. Stabbing his Lord Commander, however, is what put the boy's head in a noose.

question: What is the motto of House Tyrell?
explanation: House Tyrell's motto is "Growing Strong", while their sigil is a yellow rose on a green background. "Ours Is The Fury" is the motto of House Baratheon, "Pride and Purpose" of Buckwell and "Set Down Our Deeds" of Penrose of Parchments.

question: What is the nickname given to Brynden Tully?
explanation: Brynden Tully's nickname stuck when Hoster, his brother, called him the black goat of the family because he refused to marry to improve the family's wealth. As a response, Brynden said it was better to call him "blackfish", since Tully's sigil is a trout. Other characters have nicknames as well: Jaime Lannister was given the name Kingslayer for murdering Aerys II Targaryen, the Mad King. Petyr Baelish was born in The Fingers (The Vale) hence his nickname Littlefinger. Varys is called The Spider due to his "little birds", a huge web of informers throughout the world. Black Dread was the name given to Balerion, Aegon The Conqueror's dragon.

question: Where can we find the Moon Door?
explanation: The Moon Door, built on the floor of a room in the Eyrie, serves the purpose of throwing someone to the vale itself, located far below. There are several references to the Moon in The Vale, starting with the sigil of the House Arryn and the name of many locations throughout the place.

question: "I am your master! Kill her! Kill her!" Kraznyz mo Nakloz is yelling at whom to kill Daenerys?
explanation: Daenerys agrees to give her dragon, Drogon, to Kraznyz mo Nakloz in return for 8,000 Unsullied warriors. When the trade is complete, Kraznyz mo Nakloz goes to leave with Drogon and is angered when the dragon will not obey him. At this point, Daenerys reveals that she does not intend to part with her dragon or the Unsullied and things are not going to end well for Kraznyz mo Nakloz. He begins yelling at the Unsullied to kill Daenerys, but they will not obey as he is no longer their master. Daenerys then instructs the Unsullied to kill the slave masters.

question: What are the words of House Martell?
explanation: "Hear Me Roar" are the words of House Lannister, "Growing Strong" are the words of House Tyrell, and "Winter Is Coming' are the words of House Stark.

question: "He'll stab us in the back first chance he gets."
explanation: In season 3, Orell was killed by Jon Snow after Orell and the rest of the wildlings discovered that Jon was still a brother of the Night's Watch at heart instead of the wildling he was pretending to be. Jon was ordered to kill an innocent old man to prove he was loyal to the wildlings, and when he couldn't, Tormund Giantsbane told his men to kill Jon. During the fight, Jon kills Orell.

question: What is the name of the man that Arya kills in season 4 after he tries to kill The Hound due to the bounty on The Hound's head?
explanation: In season 4, episode 7, Arya and The Hound come across a dying man in an abandoned village. After The Hound gives the man mercy, he is attacked by two men. The first man bites The Hound but The Hound kills him. Arya quickly realizes that the second man was one of Yoren's prisoners in Season 2. The Hound asks Arya if he is on her "list", but Arya says no because she doesn't know his name. The Hound asks the man what his name is. "Rorge" he says. Arya then thanks the man and drives Needle through his heart.

question: Where was Catelyn Stark when she died?
explanation: Catelyn, Robb, and his wife were all killed during the Red Wedding at the Twins.

question: Who was Hand of the King before Eddard Stark?
explanation: It was shown in the very beginning of season 1 when he died.

question: Who was the Archmaester responsible for Sam at the Citadel?
explanation: Cressen was the maester who discovered Shireen Baratheon's greyscale affliction and treated it immediately, curing her of the disease. Pylos was the maester who developed a procedure for removing greyscale and wrote a book on the study of rare diseases. Pylos later died of greyscale, but Sam still found him worthy of using his book when treating Jorah Mormont's advanced greyscale.

question: Daenerys and Jon Snow enjoyed a sweet courtship and shared goals, never mind fierce fighting together. But which name, learned late in the series, tears them apart?
explanation: Having learned that Jon Snow is actually her nephew Aegon Targaryen, Daenerys pleads with him to keep his identity secret; to be true to her as his Queen, but also his love. She sees that the Northerners have no love for her, despite all she's done for them. She needs to know Jon is in her corner. Instead he insists on telling his family who he is, and he pulls out of her embrace and kiss. Because he can't really stomach kissing his aunt? Daenarys feels his love gone cold. "Let it be fear, then", she says, meaning if none will love her in Westeros, she will take the Iron Throne by striking fear in her subjects.

question: Who was Ros' regular customer at Winterfell?
explanation: Theon was one of Ros' regular costumers, throwing her a coin while she was leaving Winterfell and claiming that he would miss her.

question: When Olenna visits Dorne and talks to Ellaria Sand, she intentionally forgets Obara's name. What does she call Obara?
explanation: Olenna travels to Dorne and forges an alliance with Ellaria Sand and Daenerys Targaryen who was represented by Varys. While Olenna talks to Ellaria, Obara tries to speak as well. However, the Queen of Thorns replies ironically "What is your name again? Barbaro?"

question: If the Night's Watch is a brotherhood, Jon Snow is guilty of serial fratricide. Who amongst these black brothers was not slain by "Lord Snow?"
explanation: Jon Snow begrudgingly killed  Halfhand (at Halfhand's insistence) to infiltrate the Wildlings. Slynt, former commander of King's Landing's gold cloaks, was executed from refusing to follow Lord Commander Snow's orders. Jon Snow became Lord Commander following the death of Mormont, who was treasonously slain by Karl Tanner.

question: Which Houses have black as the main color of their sigil?
explanation: House Harlaw's sigil is a white scythe on a black background and the Stonetree is a tree on a black background as well. Other Houses have black as the main color of their crests, such as Greyjoy, Karstark, Lynderly, Manwoody or Rogers.

question: Shae meets Tyrion for the first time in a Lannister army's camp. Where?
explanation: Shae is a prostitute, a camp-follower. She meets Tyrion and Bronn in a tent when the Lannister army was camping in the Riverlands.

question: Daenerys crosses a desert in Essos on her way to Qarth. What is this desert called?
explanation: An extremely arid place with its many dead cities, The Red Waste is located south of the Dothraki Sea. In the southernmost part we can find Qarth, the last hope for Daenerys and her khalasar after crossing the desert.

question: How many Starks appeared in the first episode of the series?
explanation: In the first episode of season 1, we saw Eddard Stark, his wife Catelyn, their children Bran, Robb, Arya, Sansa and Rickon, as well as Eddard's brother Benjen.

question: "Kill me and be cursed. You are no king of mine!"
explanation: In season 3, Rickard Karstark was killed by Robb Stark after committing treason by killing two young innocent Lannisters. Back in season 2, Jaime Lannister killed Rickard Karstark's son, who was on guard duty, in order to free himself from his constraints. After Jaime was re-captured, Rickard demanded Jaime pay for his crimes. He was denied the request. Still out for vengeance, Rickard and his men kill two Lannister captives as a sort of revenge for the death of his son. Due to Lord Karstark's disobedience, Robb sentenced him to die.

question: What were Tywin Lannister's last words before Tyrion killed him?
explanation: After Jaime sets Tyrion free from his cell, he brings him to a set of stairs and explains to Tyrion that Varys is waiting for him. Instead of going to see Varys, Tyrion decides to sneak into Tywin's room. Surprisingly, instead of finding Tywin in his bed, Shae is lying there. After a brief moment of shock for both of them, Shae grabs a knife but Tyrion pounces on her before she can stab him. A struggle ensues, and Tyrion ends up choking Shae to death by strangling her with the necklace that she was wearing. As Tyrion is lying on the floor in tears and shock, he glances up to the wall of the bedroom and sees a crossbow. He takes the crossbow and creeps slowly to the bathroom where he suspects Tywin is. Tyrion slowly opens the door to see Tywin sitting on the toilet. After a few minutes of conversation, Tyrion shoots Tywin in the chest after he calls Shae a whore. Tywin, in shock, says "You're no son of mine". Tyrion responds by saying "I am your son. I have always been your son", and delivers the final blow.

question: Which was the crime committed by Ser Jorah Mormot when living in Westeros? This crime was the reason while he had to exile to Essos.
explanation: In order to make his wife happy, Ser Jorah needed money and it seems that the only way he figured out to get that was by trading slaves. Unlike in Essos, in Westeros slavery is illegal.

question: What is the relationship between Renly's wife and Renly's actual lover?
explanation: Renly's wife is Margaery Tyrell. He married her to get the Tyrells to fight for him during The War of Five Kings. Renly's lover is Loras Tyrell and he's Margaery's older brother.

question: How many men did Theon Greyjoy use to capture Winterfell?
explanation: He said it himself in season 2.

question: Which position on the king's small council is his closest adviser and has the power to make decisions in the king's absence?
explanation: In the first two seasons, there are three characters to hold this position.  The first is Lord Jon Arryn who dies in the first episode.  King Robert then appoints Lord Eddard Stark.  Stark is later executed as ordered by King Joffrey.  Joffrey chooses his grandfather Lord Tywin Lannister, but he is too involved in fighting the Starks and sends his dwarf-son Tyrion to act in his place.

question: Who saved Sam from being killed by a wight in the Battle of Winterfell?
explanation: Dolorous Edd saves Sam then yells "Sam get up!" As soon as Sam is back on his feet, Edd is killed in the Great War while still face to face with Sam.

question: Daenerys brings her dragons and her armies across the sea to Winterfell, in order to help Jon Snow defeat the Night King and his army. Who promised to support this war with significant troops, but was lying and never showed?
explanation: "At great cost" to herself, as she put it, Daenerys brought the Dothraki and the Unsullied armies, as well as all three of her dragons, for the Battle of Winterfell against the Night King and his zombie wights. The Hand of the Queen, Tyrion Lannister, promised that his sister Cersei, Queen in King's Landing, would send thousands of supporting soldiers. But, Jaime Lannister arrived to say Cersei "never intended" to send any assistance. Cersei wants the ranks of her enemy Daenerys to be heavily culled by the Night King. And they are. Including one of Daenerys "children", her dragon Viseron. And her beloved advisor and friend, who betrayed, protected and loved her, Ser Jorah Mormont.

question: Gendry, a bastard son of Robert Baratheon, lived most of his life in the slums of Flea Bottom in King's Landing. Here he worked as an apprentice, becoming skilled in what trade?
explanation: Gendry is a skilled blacksmith. He creates armor and weapons for whatever people he is currently with. He originally trained under Tobho Mott in Flea Bottom. After the Brotherhood without Banners captured him, he made armor and weapons for them before being sold to Melisandre.

question: Davos Seaworth is arguably Jon Snow's most trusted advisor at the moment. But before his allegiance was with Jon, Davos previously gave advice to what man, a younger brother of a former king.
explanation: Stannis was the older brother of Renly and younger brother of Robert Baratheon. When Robert dies hunting a boar, Stannis declares himself to be rightful king and joins in the War of 5 Kings. He is later executed by Brienne of Tarth for the murder of his younger brother Renly.

question: What is Rhaella's relationship to Daenerys Targaryen?
explanation: Not only was Rhaella her mother, she was also Daenerys' aunt, bearing three children from the Mad King: Daenerys, Viserys and Rhaegar.

question: What does Varys usually claim to be his aim?
explanation: Varys claims several times that his primary goal is to serve the realm and help bringing prosperity to the Seven Kingdoms.

question: Oberyn Martell died championing Tyrion Lannister in a "trial by combat." By what nickname was his killer known?
explanation: Gregor "The Mountain That Rides" Clegane crushed the head of the Dornish prince, but not before being infected with a poison-dipped spear.

question: Which House has the motto "As High as Honor"?
explanation: House Tully's motto is "Family, Duty, Honor", also using the same word which represents the importance that both Houses give to honor. House Dayne and House Redwyne do not have known mottos.

question: Who created the first White Walker?
explanation: The Children of the Forest created the first White Walker north of the Wall in an attempt to defend themselves from the First Men. Leaf, the leader of the Children, created him by pressing a dagger made of dragonglass into his chest.

question: Whose death does Arya Stark witness at the notoriously killer Red Wedding?
explanation: The Hound brings Arya to the Twins in hopes of collecting a ransom from her mother, Catelyn Stark. The Starks are at the Twins to celebrate the wedding of Edmure Tully, Catelyn's brother, and Roslin Frey. Before the Hound and Arya can enter the Frey Great Hall, fighting breaks out. While hiding behind a stack of barrels, Arya watches Frey men shoot and kill Grey Wind. Grey Wind was locked in a cage and unable to fight off his attackers as they shot arrows into the cage. While Robb Stark was killed during this event, Arya did not see it happen. Edmure was taken prisoner and the Blackfish presumably escapes.

question: How many kings did Tywin Lannister serve as the Hand?
explanation: Aerys II Targaeryn was the first king Tywin served as a hand for. After Robert's death, Tywin was made Hand of Joffrey I Baratheon. After his death, he briefly served Tommen I Baratheon, before his own murder.

question: "Do you hear? Do you hear?"
explanation: In season 4, Locke was killed by Bran Stark (warging in Hodor's body) after Locke attempted to kidnap Bran. Locke was sent to the Wall by Roose Bolton to search for Bran and Rickon Stark. While there, he overhears Jon and Sam discussing the possibility of Bran being at Craster's Keep. When Jon organizes a group of men to go to Craster's Keep to deal with the mutineers, Locke makes sure he is apart of that mission. Locke ends up finding Bran along with Hodor and the Reeds, and kidnaps Bran. Bran, being a warg, ends up warging into Hodor's body and runs after Locke, killing him in the process.

question: Where is Princess Myrcella being sent to? (This was Tyrion's idea.)
explanation: Tyrion, while acting as Hand of the King, sent of Myrcella to Dorne with the aim to secure House Martell's loyalty and also to protect his niece from the danger of King's Landing.

question: Who was on the ship Sansa was looking at while she was crying?
explanation: Littlefinger (Petyr Baelish) wanted to help Sansa escape from Kings Landing after her and Joffrey's betrothal had ended. He would take her to the Eyrie, because there he was supposed to marry Lysa Arryn. Varys didn't think Littlefinger had good reasons for helping Sansa escape, so he planned to marry Loras Tyrell to Sansa. When Sansa found out she was going to marry Loras, she instantly told Littlefinger that she didn't want to go to the Eyrie. Unfortunately the Lannister found out about the marriage pact and changed Varys' plans by letting Sansa marry Tyrion instead of Loras. When they told her, she wanted to escape again, but it was too late. Littlefinger had already left for they Eyrie.

question: Who is Joffrey, Myrcella and Tommen's real father?
explanation: Joffrey's mother Cersei and Jaime are twins.

question: For what reason was Hand of the King Eddard (Ned) Stark executed?
answer_short: Challenging Joffrey's right to be king
explanation: Through a series of events, Ned Stark discovers that Joffrey and his siblings are not the offspring of Robert Baratheon.  Their true father is their uncle Jamie Lannister meaning that Joffrey is not the rightful heir to the Iron Throne. In his attempt to use this information, Ned is betrayed and is executed for treason.

question: Which abandoned castle was the location where Sam and Gilly met up with Bran, Hodor, Jojen and Meera?
explanation: Sam read in a book that the Nightfort had a secret tunnel where Bran and his companions could get north of the Wall to the Three Eyed Raven. Shadow Tower and Eastwatch-by-the-Sea were two of the three remaining manned castles along with Castle Black. Greyguard is where Jon tried to send Janos Slynt to repair and restore, but he refused, so Jon executed Janos.

question: Preparing for war against Queen Cersei, Daenerys learns an advisor has betrayed her by spreading the secret of Jon Snow's claim to the throne. Who does she condemn to die by dragon?
explanation: At Dragonstone, in tears and furious, Daenerys tells Tyrion (Peter Dinklage) she is aware she's been betrayed. Grey Worm and the Unsullied escort Varys "the Spider" outside. Varys says to Tyrion, "I hope I am wrong" in doubting the sanity and worth of Queen Daenerys. In cold tones she pronounces him condemned to death, and commands her remaining dragon, Drogon, to sear her treasonous advisor. She warns Tyrion that since he failed her as well, if he fails her again, it will be the last time. Tyrion nonetheless frees his captive brother Jaime (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau), hoping Jaime can smuggle Cersei out of the city, thereby surrendering it to Daenerys without bloodshed.

question: Lyanna Mormont, the young ruler of Bear Island is only a girl, and is only 13 years old at the time of season 8. She shares her last name with Jorah Mormont, as they are related. How are they related?
explanation: Lyanna has had an unexpected rise to become Lady of Bear Island. Jeor Mormont, Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, was ruler of Bear Island before he willingly left to go to the Night's Watch. Jorah Mormont, Jeor's son, was ruler until he was caught selling poachers as slaves and fled to Essos. After this, Maege Mormont, younger sister to Jeor Mormont, became ruler. Maege dies (offscreen) fighting for Robb Stark and thus her daughter, Lyanna, becomes ruler.

question: Tyrion Lannister, the younger brother of Jamie and Cersei, has had a hard life. What is Tyrion's defining trait that caused him to be hated by his father, Tywin Lannister?
explanation: Tywin, Cersei, and many other people hate Tyrion mostly because he is a dwarf. It is also implied they hate him because he killed his mother. However it was not his fault, his mother died giving birth to him. Tywin never forgave him for this.

question: Who is Jon's mother?
explanation: In the season 6 finale ("The Winds of Winter") the popular fan theory named R+L=J was finally confirmed. During one of Bran's visions, we see the Tower of Joy and the birth of Jon. Lyanna made Ned promise her to take care of her son. In order to protect the boy, Ned raised him in Winterfell as his bastard son, avoiding talking about his mother and frequently saying that it was a prostitute. It is proven that Lyanna is Jon's mother during this episode, but the confirmation of Rhaegar as Jon's father was later announced by HBO itself.

question: Who wrote "Bear Island knows no king but the King in the North, whose name is Stark" in a letter adressed to Stannis Baratheon?
explanation: During his time in Castle Black, Stannis sends letters to several Houses in the North in order to ask them to join his cause. The Lady of Bear Island replies "Bear Island knows no king but the King in the North, whose name is Stark". Jon Snow reads this same letter after Stannis shows it to him.

question: The fiery sacrifice of Shireen Baratheon may have been the cruelest death on a show famous for such things. Who amongst the following was NOT complicit in the princess' haunting end?
explanation: Scarred by greyscale and hidden away by her parents, Shireen's only true friend was the Onion Knight, Ser Davos, who was unaware that she'd been sacrificed to ensure her father's victory.

question: The most well-known motto of all Houses: what is the motto of House Stark?
explanation: "Winter is coming" is not simply the motto of the Starks, but also an iconic phrase immediately connected to the world of "Game of Thrones".

question: What is the capital of Westeros?
explanation: King's Landing is the seat of the House which is ruling. It is the home of the Iron Throne, the seat of the monarch, inside the Red Keep.

question: "You killed her children. Say her name!"  Prince Oberyn Martell is shouting at the Mountain to say what name?
explanation: Oberyn volunteers to fight the Mountain as Tyrion's champion. The driving force behind this being that the Mountain killed Oberyn's sister, Elia Martell, and murdered her children during the rebellion. Elia was married to Rhaegar Targaryen and it is believed her death was ordered by Tywin Lannister.

question: What is the last name for bastards in Dorne?
explanation: Sand is the last name for bastards in Dorne (like Ellaria Sand). Storm is the name in the Stormlands, while Stone is the name in the Vale. Summer is the name of Bran's direwolf.

question: How many Starks appeared in the first episode of season 1 (pilot episode)?
explanation: List of Starks who appeared in the season 1 episode 1: 1.) Benjen Stark 2.) Ned Stark 3.) Catelyn Stark 4.) Robb Stark 5.) Sansa Stark 6.) Arya Stark 7.) Bran Stark 8.) Rickon Stark

question: Who was behind the slaughter that took place during the infamous Red Wedding?
explanation: After the massacre took place at the Twins, in King's Landing Tywin and Tyrion have a little conversation in which Tyrion accused his father of having plotted the assassination of Robb Stark and his men. To this, Lord Lannister answers than some battles are won by the sword and others by the quill.

question: Who was Shagga's father?
explanation: Shagga said, "If you're lying to me halfman, I Shagga, son of Dolf, will chop of you manhood and..." Tyrion replies, "...And feed it to the goats, yes."

question: What king dies in season 1?
explanation: After Robert died, many fought for the throne.

question: Daenerys Targaryen has three children. These "children" are actually what?
explanation: Daenerys, who feels she has a rightful claim to the Iron Throne, is given three dragon eggs as a wedding gift.  When her husband Kahl Drago dies, she puts his body on a funeral pyre.  Daenerys, who has the supernatural ability to withstand heat, walks into the fire with the eggs and uses the heat to hatch them.  These dragons are the first to come into the world in over a century.

question: What is Eddard Stark's kinship to Jon Snow?
explanation: For five seasons we were meant to believe that Jon was the bastard son of Ned Stark. His real parents were revealed in the season 6 finale to be Lyanna Stark and Rhaegar Targaryen. Since Lyanna was Ned's sister, he is Jon's maternal uncle.

question: "Do it quickly."
explanation: In season 2, Maester Luwin was killed by Osha on his demand after suffering a fatal wound from one of the Ironborn soldiers. After Ramsay Snow and his men surround Winterfell, Theon Greyjoy decides to rally up the few Greyjoy soldiers to fight. Knowing they will most likely die, Theon gives a speech. After the speech, Theon is knocked unconscious by one of his men. Maester Luwin, confused, rushes to help Theon, but is stabbed in the process. Severely wounded, he still manages to make his way to the big weirdwood tree in the Godswood, where he is met by Bran, Rickon, Osha, and Hodor. Maester Luwin instructs the group to go to the Wall where he knows they will be safe. As they are leaving, he tells Osha to put him out of his misery.

question: Which kings did Jaime Lannister serve as a Kingsguard?
answer_short: Aerys II, Robert Baratheon and Joffrey Baratheon
explanation: Jaime longed for a position in the Kingsguard since his teenage years. He served during the reign of Aerys II, the Mad King, whom he murdered after Aerys insanely repeated the order "burn them all", receiving the infamous nickname Kingslayer. After Robert's Rebellion, Jaime was forgiven by the monarch and remained in the Kingsguard until Tommen Baratheon dismissed him.

question: "Give me something for the pain, and let me die."
explanation: In season 1, Robert Baratheon was killed by a boar after he drank too much wine and was attacked during a hunt. King Robert loved to hunt, and he loved to drink as well. During one of his hunts, he drinks too much wine, causing his hunting skills to weaken. He is attacked by a wild boar, and is fatally wounded. What most likely occurred was Lancel Lannister, the King's squire, was instructed by Queen Cersei to give King Robert as much wine as possible so he wouldn't be fully prepared in case of an animal attack. She probably did this because Ned was going to reveal the truth about the incest between Cersei and Jaime to him.

question: What is Visenya Targaryen's relationship to Aegon I?
explanation: Aegon I, the Conqueror, was Visenya's husband and brother. It is not uncommon to Targaryens, since they did it to preserve the purity of their bloodline (often resulting in a tendency to insanity).

question: Arthur Dayne was a member of the Kingsguard of which king?
explanation: Arthur Dayne, also called the Sword of the Morning for bearing the sword Dawn, served in the Kingsguard of Aerys II. We can see him being stabbed by Howland Reed and beheaded by Eddard Stark when Ned was trying to reach Lyanna in the Tower of Joy.

question: "I shall have your head for this!"
explanation: In season 3, Lord Commander Mormont was killed by Rast during the mutiny in Craster's Keep. While staying at Craster's Keep, one of the Night's Watchmen, Karl, decides to challenge Craster about the portions of food they are receiving. Karl ends up calling Craster a bastard, and kills Craster. A fight commences, and Rast, siding with Karl, kills Commander Mormont.

question: "Gods help you Theon Greyjoy. Now you are truly lost."
explanation: In season 2, Rodrik Cassel was beheaded by Theon Greyjoy for spitting in Theon's face. After Theon Greyjoy takes Winterfell with his men, Ser Rodrik is captured. Shocked with disgust, Ser Rodrik spits in Theon's face. When Theon orders Ser Rodrik to be placed in the dungeons, he is pressured into having Ser Rodrik pay the iron price for his crime...death.
